# Frontend Second Semester Examination Project

## Table of Contents
- [Description](#description)
- [Questions](#questions)
- [Modality of Submission](#modality-of-submission)
- [Libraries Used](#libraries-used)
- [How to Run](#how-to-run)
- [Submission Link](#submission-link)

## Description
This repository contains my solution to the Frontend Second Semester Examination Project. The project is implemented using React and includes a GitHub portfolio page and other features.

## Questions
I have chosen to implement the following question:

**Question:**
1. Implement an API fetch of your GitHub portfolio, show a page with a list of all your repositories on GitHub, and create another page showing data for a single repo clicked from the page showing all repos using nested routes while using all the necessary tools in react. Implement an Error Boundary (show a page to test the error boundary) and 404 pages. Good UI and Designs are important.

## Modality of Submission
1. Your code should be well documented with a requirement.txt file that contains all your libraries used for the project.
2. Push your code to Github.
3. Host your application on Heroku/Netlify.
4. Submit using the link below:
   Submission Link: [AltSchool of Frontend Engineering v2 2nd Semester Exam Submission Link](https://forms.gle/hY3WQKNG74nQhYfR7)


## Libraries Used

Here are some of the libraries and dependencies used in this project:

1. **React**: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces. [Link to React](https://reactjs.org/)

2. **React Router**: A library for handling routing in a React application. [Link to React Router](https://reactrouter.com/)

3. **React Scroll**: A library for smooth scrolling within a React application. [Link to React Scroll](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-scroll)

4. **Web Vitals**: A library for measuring and tracking web performance. [Link to Web Vitals](https://www.npmjs.com/package/web-vitals)

5. **useNavigate**: A hook from React Router for programmatic navigation. [Link to React Router useNavigate](https://reactrouter.com/web/api/useNavigate)

6. **useState**: A built-in React hook for managing component state. [Link to useState](https://reactjs.org/docs/hooks-state.html)

7. **useEffect**: A built-in React hook for side effects in function components. [Link to useEffect](https://reactjs.org/docs/hooks-effect.html) 

8. **useRef**: A built-in React hook for creating mutable object properties. [Link to useRef](https://reactjs.org/docs/hooks-reference.html#useref) 

9. **useParams**: A hook from React Router for accessing URL parameters. [Link to React Router useParams](https://reactrouter.com/web/api/Hooks/useparams)

10. **fetch**: A built-in JavaScript function for making network requests. [Link to Fetch API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fetch_API) 

11. **fetch API**: A browser API for making network requests. [Link to Fetch API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fetch_APIhttps://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fetch_API)
